name: Altrua HealthShare
statementOfFaith: Members agree to Statement of Standards: caring for one another, healthy lifestyle with proper nutrition, rejecting tobacco/illicit drugs/excessive alcohol, sexual relations only within marriage, all life is sacred gift from God, family care is essential.

preExisting.sharingLimits: 10-year lookback period. 2-5 year waiting periods depending on condition. Some conditions (MS, type 1 diabetes) have lifetime exclusions.

bestFor: Budget-conscious Christians wanting flexible plan tiers with pooled office visits and a 30-year track record
pros: Nearly 30-year operational history (founded 1996) — one of the longest-running health sharing ministries
Four distinct plan tiers from budget Ruby to comprehensive Diamond
Pooled office visits (6 per member/year) shareable among household members
Light faith requirements — no church attendance verification
30-day free trial period with full refund option
cons: Strict pre-existing condition policy — 10-year lookback, 2-5 year waiting periods, some lifetime exclusions
Lifetime sharing caps on all plans ($1M-$2M) limit catastrophic protection
Maternity only on Diamond and Emerald plans with $5,000 additional MRA
Dependents only covered until age 23 (younger than ACA standard of 26)
aiSummary: Altrua HealthShare is a Christian health sharing ministry founded in 1996 in Bee Cave, TX with approximately 25,000 members. It offers four 'Gem' tier plans: Diamond ($356-$617/mo individual, $500 MRA), Emerald ($318-$528/mo, $1,000 MRA), Sapphire ($173-$424/mo, $1,500 MRA), and Ruby ($113-$297/mo, $7,500 MRA). Uses First Health/PHCS network with 1M+ providers. Light Christian faith requirement with no church attendance verification. Has one of the strictest pre-existing condition policies in the industry: 10-year lookback, 2-5 year waiting periods, and some lifetime exclusions. Offers unique features like pooled office visits and SmileShare dental add-on.
aiKeyFacts: Christian faith requirement (light — no church attendance)
10-year pre-existing condition lookback with 2-5 year waits
6 pooled office visits per member/year shared among household
